SEARCH
Package com.discretask.structures

Class Heap<T>

java.lang.Object
com.discretask.structures.Heap<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPriorityQueue<T>
public class Heap<T> extends Object implements IPriorityQueue<T>
The Heap class is an implementation of the IPriorityQueue interface.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Heap(Comparator<T> comparator)
    This is a default constructor for a heap that initializes the size of the heap to zero and initializes the heap variable to an array of type T.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    add(T item)
    The add function adds an item to the heap, resizing if necessary, and then performs heapifyUp to maintain the heap property.
    void
    clear()
    The clear() function clears the heap by creating a new array of objects and setting the size to 0.
    void
    getHeap(T[] result)
    The function `getHeap` copies the elements of the heap array into the result array.
    boolean
    isEmpty()
    The function checks if the data structure is empty by comparing its size to zero.
    T
    poll()
    The function removes and returns the top element from a heap data structure.
    T
    remove(T element)
    The remove function removes an element from the heap and returns the removed element.
    int
    size()
    The function returns the size of a data structure.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
